title: Changed spice serving count from null to 1.0
bodyText: While each row is built, the checkbox is loaded based on the count of serving it can go up to. With a null serving count (-1), no checkbox will be loaded.

title: Feature/v9 notification
bodyText: This pull request adds a Daily Update Reminder. The user can configure a daily reminder notification to display at a certain time as well as whether to vibrate or play a sound. A default daily update reminder is created on the first run of the app or the next after an upgrade.

Hello,
As the How Not to Die book has been recently translated into romanian and published in print format, I would like to contribute my own translations for the translatable strings defined in the Android app.
The translations are made by me and double checked and corroborated using:

Wikipedia and Wiktionary articles
Google Translate and Bing Translator
The recently published romanian translation of the How Not to Die book
Other Internet sites

#hacktoberfest

#hacktoberfest

title: Add support for deploying to F-Droid repository
bodyText:
Added support in the Gradle build files for play and fdroid product flavors
Excluded Crashlytics Android SDK from fdroid product flavor
Created F-Droid full metadata file for inclusion in F-Droid repository (see metadata/org.nutritionfacts.dailydozen.txt)
Created information with all the open source licenses used by each product flavor
(see metadata/F-Droid Open source licenses.txt and metadata/Google Play Open source licenses.txt)
Created build-fdroid.sh script that details the steps needed to build a Daily Dozen APK for F-Droid
Added info about F-Droid release to README.md

TODO:

 The app complies with the inclusion criteria
 Builds with fdroid build
 Sign build and test it (logs)
 The original app author has been notified
 The original app author supports the inclusion
 Submit Proposal by Metadata Merge Request
https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/merge_requests/2746
 F-Droid support merged into master branch

Useful docs:

https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/blob/master/README.md
https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md
https://f-droid.org/wiki/page/Repository_Style_Guide
https://f-droid.org/docs/Build_Metadata_Reference/
https://gitlab.com/fdroid/artwork/tree/master/badge#badge

Fixes issues: #59
New releases are automatically built by F-Droid server because of the following metadata parameters:

Auto Update Mode:Version v%v
Update Check Mode:Tags ^v[0-9.]*$

Just need to tag new releases (as it is already the case) and F-Droid server will automatically build fdroidRelease build variant and sign it with its own app signing key and publish the update.
I've tested the update procedure using the metadata/build-fdroid.sh script and it works.
I've updated the org.nutritionfacts.dailydozen.txt to use my master branch, because that's where it would look like if this pull request would get merged:

https://github.com/alibitek/daily-dozen-android/commits/master
https://github.com/alibitek/daily-dozen-android/releases
F-Droid automatically adds a new build config for the v16 tag: https://gist.github.com/alibitek/04581bb4650867d53a55d2d5708337dd
Update logs: https://gist.github.com/alibitek/74ac5f84101d04e12ff7a3d4c9e1a40e

#hacktoberfest

title: Fix error "Could not find com.android.tools.build:gradle:3.0.1"
bodyText:
As per the Configure Your Build documentation Google's repository is needed when using Android plugin for Gradle version 3.0.1 as a classpath dependency.
The building from the command line also fails:
./gradlew assembleDebug

FAILURE: Build failed with an exception.

* What went wrong:
A problem occurred configuring root project 'daily-dozen-android'.
> Could not resolve all files for configuration ':classpath'.
   > Could not find com.android.tools.build:gradle:3.0.1.
     Searched in the following locations:
         https://jcenter.bintray.com/com/android/tools/build/gradle/3.0.1/gradle-3.0.1.pom
         https://jcenter.bintray.com/com/android/tools/build/gradle/3.0.1/gradle-3.0.1.jar
     Required by:
         project :

* Try:
Run with --stacktrace option to get the stack trace. Run with --info or --debug option to get more log output.

* Get more help at https://help.gradle.org


Not sure why it works without it from Android Studio.
Encountered this error while running build-fdroid.sh to test if the F-Droid build works locally: https://forum.f-droid.org/t/build-failing-with-could-not-find-gradle-error/1612

title: Correct Chinese translation and convert new entries to traditional
bodyText:
Some of the translations were incorrect in confusing or funny ways...
e.g. "Fast every night" became "every night quick", "deflour your diet" became "decrease diet" etc.
Also, the original translations here for Chinese (zh) were all in Traditional characters. I think we should do a separate simplified and traditional translation, but for now at least we can make this consistent.
Now, this isn't a perfect translation, but it's an improvement.

title: Force dark mode
bodyText:
Uses Android's force dark mode - looks good, but it is worth investigating creating a whole theme in a future iteration
Adds a menu item that is visible for API level 29 and up
Options include Dark, Light, or System Default
Settings persist
TODO: translations will need to be added

title: Force Dark Mode Tweaks
bodyText:
This PR fixes the following minor issues with using the Force Dark mode added in API level 29:

Force Dark mode is disabled on the StreakWidget as its normal colors look good in dark mode.
Force Dark mode is disabled in the calendar history views and the background is set to gray so as not to blind at night.
The color of the moving average line is changed to gold in dark mode to improve legibility.

title: Polish Translation with some correlated Android/Apple updates
bodyText:
@slavick This pull request provides a Polish translation plus some updates to help coordinate translations for the both Android & Apple platforms. This pull request performs the following:

Adds a Polish translation based on the spreadsheets submitted by @Hangur (with feedback from @senpl).
Sets Chickpeas/Garbanzo Beans as a single synonym item based on a past email thread.
Treats arrays with <item>@.../... as translatable="false".

Note: The translatable="false" attributes help automate the intake of the spreadsheet translations. Please let me know if non-translatable is not the correct understanding of the <item>@.../... lists.
The values-pl/strings.xml file was programmatically generated.
Please let me know if you find issues with any of the file updates.

title: en, ca, de, he (iw), pt (rBR/rPT), ru udpates.
bodyText:
The automatic generation of XML generation has the following updates:

Removed  translatable="false" attribute for history_to_generate_choices
Nodes with a translatable="false" attribute no longer populate the translated files.
Formats <item></item> to <item />
Escapes apostrophy to be \' in the content text.
• More complete XML heading: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" standalone="yes"?>

See: nutritionfactsorg/daily-dozen-localization@c675805
The follow change was was done to the TSV file and propagated to the generated XML file.

For Hebrew 1/4 and 1/2 were replaced with UTF-8 ¼ and ½. Hopefully this avoids the need for <![CDATA[&#…; …]]>

At this time, the Hebrew (iw) file is a manual copy of the Hebrew (he) xml file. The ISO Hebrew code was changed from the original original ISO 639:1988 iw to he in 1989.  My understanding is that the current iw status being "used previously but no longer assigned". Just wondering... is iw still needed on the Android platform? or can the iw copy be dropped?
Please let me know how these updates work for you. And, if anything needs to be fixed.

title: ca, pt (rPT) translations xml update

title: v21
bodyText: Adds Catalan, German, Hebrew, Polish, Portuguese and Russian.

title: unified imperial, metric strings (removes need for %s separate.)
russian update, escaped quotes, %s simplification
bodyText:
@slavick This PR has several updates:

Russian has an upated translation. see nutritionfactsorg/daily-dozen-localization#9
Resolves an issues daily-dozen-localization where the single quote should be escaped as \' when generating the strings.xml files.

This would affect the presentation of several translations (e.g. Italian which use lots of single quotes).


The double quotes are also now escaped \" in the content.

Note: adding/dropping double quote escaping in the strings.xml generation is a single line of code to change  nutritionfactsorg/daily-dozen-localization@ea7ec85

"\\\"" in a Swift String literial becomes \" internally.




The uses of %1$s have been replaced with a simplified %s. The thinking is:

1$ does not appear to be programmatically needed in the Java code.
%s formatter can also work in the iOS Swift code.

A common format allows for several translation rows to be common for the Android and Apple devices.
However, %1$s is not support in a Swift formatter string.


%s is easer than %1$s for translators to work with in the spreadsheet

title: Spanish Update
bodyText:
Updated Spanish. Couple Trendelberg \n\n formatting fixes. (Note: has programmer aknowledgemets)
@slavick Some comments will be emailed separately.

title: Simplified Chinese (zh-Hans) addition. Traditional Chinese (zh-Hant) relocation.
bodyText:
Note: Folder name fragments zh-Hans and zh-Hant are based on iOS localization convention. These folder name fragments still need to be verified to be accurate for Android OS.
Simplified Chinese (zh-Hans)

Adds Simplified Chinese (zh-Hans) translation in values-zh-Hans.

Traditional Chinese (zh-Hant)

Places Traditional Chinese (zh-Hans) translation in values-zh-Hant.
values-zh is redundant now to values-zh-Hant.

I left values-zh in-place to not break the current build as-is.
If values-zh can be removed in favor of just using a more specific folder name (e.g. values-zh-Hant), this would reduced redundancy in the localization workflow.
